com.Grateds.game.AI.lib

Interface AbstractSearchProblem<S extends State>


  • public interface AbstractSearchProblem<S extends State>
    Title: AbstractSearchProblem

    Description: IInterface which defines the basic elements necessary for characterising a problem as a search. Instances of these problems should implement this interface, to be able to use the search strategies.

    Copyright: Copyright (c) Grateds 2014 Company: Grateds

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Grateds

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<S> getSuccessors(S s)
      Returns the list of successor states for a given state, in the context of the current problem.
      S initialState()
      Returns the initial state corresponding to the problem.
      boolean success(S s)
      Indicates whether a given state is a successful state, in the context of the current problem.

    • Method Detail

      • initialState

        S initialState()
        Returns the initial state corresponding to the problem. Concrete implementations of AbstractSearchProblem must implement this routine, to indicate the starting point for the search.
        Returns:
        the initial state for the problem

      • getSuccessors

        java.util.List<S> getSuccessors(S s)
        Returns the list of successor states for a given state, in the context of the current problem. Concrete implementations of AbstractSearchProblem must implement this routine, to indicate the 'advance' rules for the search.
        Parameters:
        s - is the state for which its successors are being computed.
        Returns:
        the list of successor states of s.

      • success

        boolean success(S s)
        Indicates whether a given state is a successful state, in the context of the current problem. Concrete implementations of AbstractSearchProblem must implement this routine, to indicate when the search has been successful.
        Parameters:
        s - is the state being checked to be successful.
        Returns:
        true iff s is a successful state.
